column5: Can anyone suggest a good bait shop between Baudette & Morson?Looking for leeches by the pound or half pound for the weekend.

Have never seen a baitshop between Baudette and Morson. Have made that trip at least once a year since 1989. We used to buy leeches in Baudette when you could still bring them across the border. Your best bet for a bait shop would be to cross the border at International Falls and buy leeches in Ft. Francis. With enough advance notification, Justin at Mylie's Place Resort near Hansons Bay, may be able to supply them for you. [email protected] 1-866-395-3449 tolll-free. Marv

There are a couple of resorts and a marina that have bait available, including us as Marv pointed out (thanks Marv.) We keep minnows and leeches available at all times unless there is a severe shortage from suppliers. It's the same situation with BV and Morson Marina. There is no bait shops between Rainy River and Morson. The resort community as a whole is happy to provide bait for our visitors and I know I speak for all operators in saying we appreciate your support up here.Thanks.

Thanks for the info, we are staying on the Ontario side of the rainy river just to the west of baudette. Was just checking options. We may give u a visit at mylies if we can't find enough at harris hill

It's been a few years since I've been on that road, but there used to be a bait shop in a small community on the right as you are heading north. I believe it was connected to the folks' house. Bill Krejca
Go to emo, they have leeches. It's about 35 mins east of rainy. Stop in for a fish too, I'll be at the manitou rapids, lol
The Marina in Morson has very good leeches. Was there last weekend. They sell by the pound and 1/2 lb.
Oh yeah, Tomv has it nailed.nevermind Emo, would be a waste of time
